alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Rawlins; Sheridan; Thomas (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 1:57PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN THOMAS... NORTHWESTERN SHERIDAN...SOUTHEASTERN RAWLINS...DECATUR AND SOUTHEASTERN RED WILLOW COUNTIES THROUGH 230 PM CDT... At 156 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Selden, or 15 miles southwest of Oberlin, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Oberlin around 205 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Danbury. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Kansas...and southwestern Nebraska.
